data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانَ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
The word فَكَيْفَ comes from the root ك ي ف and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word عَذَابِي comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: to return, turn away, come back, repeat, restore. aidun - one who returns. ma'adun - place where one returns, another name of Makkah. a'ada (vb. 4) - to cause to return, restore. The verb a'ada is transitive to mean to get some one return or cause to return or bring back (what has passed away).. AAad - An Arab tribe which lived in the south of the Arabian peninsula and occupied land extending from the north of the Persian Gulf to the southern end of the Red Sea. The tribe of AAad spoken of in The Quran is also called the first/ancient AAad (53:50) in order to distinguish them from the people of Thamud who are called the second AAad. The Adramites of Yemen mentioned in the Greek history are considered to be this tribe.. . 'Aada (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): Returned; Reverted.. 'Aaduu (prf. 3rd. m. plu.): They returned, reverted.. 'Udtum (prf. 2nd. plu.): You returned.. 'Udnaa (prf. 1st. plu.): We returned.. Yu'uuduuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu.): They return.. Ya'uuduu (imp. 3rd. m. plu. final Nun drop.): You return.. Ta'uuduuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): Ye return.. Ta'uuduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. final Nun dropped).. Ta'uudunna (imp. 2nd. m. sing. imp.): Assuredly ye shall return.. Na'uudu (imp. 1st. plu.): We return.. Na'ud .W (imp. 1st. plu. Waw dropped): We return.. Yu'iidu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. IV): They shall repeat, return.. Yu'iiduu (final Nun dropped): They restore, make (you) revert to.. Nu'iidu (imp. 1st. plu.): We restore; We will make you return.. 'Uiiduu (pip. 3rd. m. plu. IV): They will be hurled back.. A'iiduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Those who return.. Ma'aadun (n.): Place of return; Home.. 'Idan: Ever recurring; Festival; Periodical; Feast day.
data.sentence: The word عَادٌ comes from the root ع و د and is associated with the meanings: to return, turn away, come back, repeat, restore. aidun - one who returns. ma'adun - place where one returns, another name of Makkah. a'ada (vb. 4) - to cause to return, restore. The verb a'ada is transitive to mean to get some one return or cause to return or bring back (what has passed away).. AAad - An Arab tribe which lived in the south of the Arabian peninsula and occupied land extending from the north of the Persian Gulf to the southern end of the Red Sea. The tribe of AAad spoken of in The Quran is also called the first/ancient AAad (53:50) in order to distinguish them from the people of Thamud who are called the second AAad. The Adramites of Yemen mentioned in the Greek history are considered to be this tribe.. . 'Aada (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): Returned; Reverted.. 'Aaduu (prf. 3rd. m. plu.): They returned, reverted.. 'Udtum (prf. 2nd. plu.): You returned.. 'Udnaa (prf. 1st. plu.): We returned.. Yu'uuduuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu.): They return.. Ya'uuduu (imp. 3rd. m. plu. final Nun drop.): You return.. Ta'uuduuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): Ye return.. Ta'uuduu (imp. 2nd. m. plu. final Nun dropped).. Ta'uudunna (imp. 2nd. m. sing. imp.): Assuredly ye shall return.. Na'uudu (imp. 1st. plu.): We return.. Na'ud .W (imp. 1st. plu. Waw dropped): We return.. Yu'iidu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. IV): They shall repeat, return.. Yu'iiduu (final Nun dropped): They restore, make (you) revert to.. Nu'iidu (imp. 1st. plu.): We restore; We will make you return.. 'Uiiduu (pip. 3rd. m. plu. IV): They will be hurled back.. A'iiduuna (act. pic. m. plu.): Those who return.. Ma'aadun (n.): Place of return; Home.. 'Idan: Ever recurring; Festival; Periodical; Feast day.

data.meanings: To lie, say what is not a fact, lie to falsely invent, tell lies about or against, fabricate a lie, relate a lie, say a falsehood, be wrong, be cut off, deceive, disappoint the expectation of.
data.sentence: The word كَذَّبَتْ comes from the root ك ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: To lie, say what is not a fact, lie to falsely invent, tell lies about or against, fabricate a lie, relate a lie, say a falsehood, be wrong, be cut off, deceive, disappoint the expectation of.

data.meanings: (Nun-Thal-Ra) to dedicate, make a vow, warn, admonish, caution, promise voluntarily, offer present. nadhiir - warner, one who informs and averts calamity, who cautions and put one on guard.
data.sentence: The word وَنُذُرِ comes from the root ن ذ ر and is associated with the meanings: (Nun-Thal-Ra) to dedicate, make a vow, warn, admonish, caution, promise voluntarily, offer present. nadhiir - warner, one who informs and averts calamity, who cautions and put one on guard.
